07/02/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ If teaching does not match the truth in God's
Word, then it is twisted...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Even if we or an angel from heaven should preach a gospel
other than the one we preached to you, let him be eternally
condemned...

As we have already said, so now I say again: If anybody is 
preaching to you a gospel other than what you have accepted,
let him be eternally condemned! (Gal 1:8, 9) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul strongly denounces anyone who twists the teaching of
the Good News of Jesus Christ. He says that even if an angel
from heaven came preaching some other message, that angel
should be "forever cursed."

If an angel came preaching another message, he would not be
from heaven, no matter how he looked. Paul at another time 
has warned that Satan disguises himself as an angel of light...

Our messages must never change, because the Good News never changes...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to always remain true to the
gospel. Help me to be sensitive to Your Holy Spirits leading.
For I ask it in Jesus Name...Amen.

Keep looking up, and He will guide you in the way you shall go...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

07/03/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Pray always for the courage seek God's approval...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Am I now trying to win the approval of men, or of God?
Or am I trying to please men? If I were still trying to
please men, I would not be a servant of Christ...(Gal. 1:10) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Do you seem to be spending your life pleasing everybody?

Paul had to speak harshly to the Christians in Galatia they were in serious
danger. Paul did not apologize for his straight-forward words, knowing
that they could not serve Christ faithfully if he allowed the Galatian Christians 
to remain on the wrong track...

Whose approval are you seeking ~ others or God's? Pray for the courage
to seek God's approval above anyone else's...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to be polite to those around me,
but also help me to remember that I owe my life to You, so there
will be times I will have to have the courage to say no to man in
order to say yes to You. I pray for a safe holiday for all my e-mail
friends...Amen.

Keep looking up, remembering who we truly serve...
You are in the Prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

07/04/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ We can follow church ritual to the tee
but that will never guarantee us eternal life...

Our Bible verses for Today:

Paul says: "I was one of the most religious Jews of my own age.
and I tried as hard as possible to follow all the old traditions of
my religion...

But then something happened! For it pleased God in His kindness 
to choose me and call me, even before I was born! What undeserved
mercy!

Then He revealed His Son to me so that I could proclaim the Good 
News about Jesus to the Gentiles. When all this happened to me, 
I did not rush out to consult with anyone else. (Gal. I:14-15) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Because God was guiding his ministry, Paul wasn't doing anything
that God hadn't already planned and given him power to do...

Similarly, God appointed Jeremiah to be His spokesman even
before Jeremiah was born (Jer. 1:5)...

God knows each one of us intimately as well, and He chose you
to be His even before you were born (see Ps. 139). He wants you 
to draw close to Him and fulfill the purpose He has for your life...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear heavenly Father, help me to always be alert to Your
will for my life. Help me to be ready at all times to witness
for You...Amen.

Keep looking up, He wants to show you the purpose for your life...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

07/05/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Did you remember to give thanks this 
year for the freedom we enjoy?

Our Bible Verses for Today:

They only heard the report: "The man who formerly persecuted 
us is now preaching the faith he once tried to destroy...

And they praised God because of me...(Gal. 1:23, 24) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Paul's changed life had brought praise from those who saw him
or heard about him. His new life had astonished them. They had 
praised God because only God could have turned this zealous 
persecutor of Christians into a Christian himself...

We may not have had as dramatic a change as Paul, but still our
new life should honor God in every way. When people look at you, 
do they recognize that God has made changes in you?

If not perhaps your not living as you should...

Our prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for what You have done
in my life, but I still need further help, I don't always live as 
I should...Amen.

Keep looking up, He has more he wants to do in your life...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

07/07/08 ~~~(food for thought) ~~~ Time spent in the study of the Bible, is time well spent...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Fourteen years later I went up again to Jerusalem, this time
with Barnabas. I took Titus along also...

I went in response to a revelation and set before them the
gospel that I preached among the Gentiles. But I did this
privately to those who seemed to be leaders, for fear that 
I was running or had run my race in vain...(Gal. 2:1, 2) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

God had told Paul through a revelation to confer with the Church
leaders in Jerusalem about the message he was preaching to
the Gentiles, so they would understand and approve of what he
was doing...

The substance of Paul's message to both the Jews and the Gentiles
was that God's salvation is offered to all people regardless of race,
sex, nationality, wealth, social standing, educational level, or anything 
else...

Anyone can be forgiven by trusting in Christ...(see Romans 10:8-13)

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank you for the free gift of salvation
to all who will believe. Lord I believe help me in my unbelief...Amen.

Keep looking up, He is the One who will lead you home...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

07/08/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Good communications reduces gossip...

Our Bible verses for Today:

Because some false brothers had infiltrated our ranks to spy
on the freedom we have in Christ Jesus and to make us slaves...

We did not give in to them for a moment, so that the truth of
the gospel might remain with you... (Gal. 2:4, 5) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

We normally think of taking a stand against those who might lead
us into immoral behavior, but Paul had to take a hard-line against
the most "moral" of people...

We must not give in to those who make the keeping of man-made 
standards a condition for salvation, even when such people are 
morally upright or in respected positions...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, guide me in the truth that I might not
fall into the trap of believing in some man-made standards for
salvation, for Your Son Jesus Christ says, "I am the way, the
truth and the life, and no one comes to the Father but by me...Amen.

Keep looking to the Way...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

07/10/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Walk softly; speak tenderly; pray fervently...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

When Peter came to Antioch, (Paul says) I opposed him to his face,
because he was clearly in the wrong...

Before certain men came from James, he used to eat with the Gentiles.
But when they arrived, he began to draw back and separate himself 
from the Gentiles because he was afraid of those who belonged to the
circumcision group...(Gal 2:11, 12) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Even though Peter was the leader of the church he was acting like a
hypocrite. He knew better, yet he was driven by fear of what James 
and the others would think...

Pro. 29:25 says, "Fearing people is a dangerous trap." Paul knew
that he had to confront Peter before his actions damaged the church...

So, Paul publicly opposed Peter. But we need to note, that Paul did not
go the other leaders, nor did he write letters to the churches telling
them not to follow Peter's example. Instead he opposed Peter face to face...

Sometimes sincere Christians even Christian leaders, make mistakes,
and it takes other sincere Christians to get them back on track. If you are
convinced that someone is doing harm to himself/herself or the church, 
try the direct approach...

There is no place for back-stabbing in the body of Christ...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, help me to remain humbles yet honest
and straight to the point while correcting a straying Christian.
Help me to remember that Christians are to be shepherds not
commandos...Amen.

Keep looking up, for Godly wisdom...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

07/11/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Set aside a special day to remember loved ones
who are no longer alive...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

We who are Jews by birth and not Gentile sinners,
know that a man is not justified by observing the law,
but by faith in Jesus Christ. So we, too, have put our
faith in Christ Jesus that we may be justified by faith
in Christ and not by observing the law, because by
observing the law no one will be justified...(Gal. 2:15, 16) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

If observing the Jewish laws cannot justify us, why should we still obey
the Ten Commandments and other Old Testament laws?

We know that Paul was not saying the law is bad, because in another
letter he wrote, "The law itself is holy and right and good." (Ro. 7:12)

What Paul is really saying is that the law can never make us acceptable
to God. The law still has an important role to play in the life of a Christian.

The law:
(1) guards us from sin by giving us standards for behavior.
(2) It convicts us of sin, leaving us the opportunity to as for God's forgiveness...
(3) It drives us to trust in the sufficiency of Christ, because we can never keep
the Ten Commandments perfectly...

The law cannot possibly save us. But after we become Christians, it can
guide us to live as God requires...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for Your guidance 
that I may not sin against you. I pray for added faith
that I may trust wholly in Christ Jesus my Savior...Amen.

Keep looking up, He will give you wisdom...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Ps. I have to be in Grand Forks with a couple of patience
so I may miss Saturdays devotion...

07/21/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Let us never compromise the truth of 
God's Word...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

If, while we seek to be justified in Christ, it becomes evident
that we ourselves are sinners, does that mean that Christ 
promotes sin? Absolutely not!

If I rebuild what I destroyed, I prove that I am a law breaker,

For through the law I died to the law so that I might live for God.
(Gal. 2:17-19) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Through the study of the Old Testament Scriptures, Paul realized
that he could not be saved by obeying God's Laws. The prophets 
knew that God's plan of salvation did not rest on keeping the law...

Because we have all been infected by sin, we can not keep God's 
laws perfectly. Fortunately, God has provided a way of salvation
that depends upon Jesus Christ, not on our own efforts...

Even though we know this truth, we must guard against the temptation 
of using service, good deeds, charitable giving, or any other effort as
a substitute for faith...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Forgive me for the times I 
slip into thinking that my service is my open door to
eternal life, I truly know better, but it is my human
nature to want have a hand in seeking Your favor. I 
know that my works are but filthy rags...Amen.

Keep looking up, from whence cometh our strength
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

07/22/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ We have been crucified with Christ...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

I have been crucified with Christ and I no longer live, but Christ lives 
in me. The life I live in the body, I live by faith in the Son of God, 
who loved me and gave Himself for me...(Gal. 2:20) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

How have we been crucified with Christ? WELL!!! Legally, God looks at 
us as if we had died with Christ. Because our sins died with Him, we are
no longer condemned (Col 2:13-15)...

Relationally we have become one with Christ, and His experiences are ours.
Our Christian life began when, in unity with Him, we died to our old life
(Ro. 6:5-11). In our daily life, we must regularly crucify sinful desires that
keep us from following Christ...

This, too, is a kind of dying with in Him (Lk. 9:23-25). Yet the focus of 
Christianity is not, dying but on living...

Because we have been crucified with Christ, we have also been raised with 
Him (Ro. 6:5). We have been reconciled to God...Amen.

Our Prayer for Today:
I thank You Lord Jesus for Your great and awesome love
that You would take my place on the cross, so that I might
have eternal life. Bless all my e-mail friends today...Amen.

Keep looking up, for added strength...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

reflection: How have we been crucified with Christ? WELL!!! Legally, God looks at us as if we had died with Christ. Because our sins died with Him, we are no longer condemned (Colossians 2:13-15). Relationally we have become one with Christ, and His experiences are ours. Our Christian life began when, in unity with Him, we died to our old life (Romans 6:5-11). In our daily life, we must regularly crucify sinful desires that keep us from following Christ. This, too, is a kind of dying with in Him (Luke 9:23-25). Yet the focus of Christianity is not, dying but on living. Because we have been crucified with Christ, we have also been raised with Him (Romans 6:5). We have been reconciled to God. Amen.
subject: Crucified with Christ: Our New Life in Him

07/24/08~~~(food for thought)~~~We need to remember our bodies are 
the temple of the Holy Spirit...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

I do not set aside the grace of God, for if righteousness could be
gained through the law, Christ died for nothing...(Gal. 2:21) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Believers today may still be in danger of acting as if Christ died
for nothing. HOW? By replacing Jewish legalism with their own
brand of Christian legalism, they are giving people extra laws to
obey...

By believing they can earn God's favor by what they do, they are 
not trusting completely in Christ's work on the cross. By struggling 
to appropriate God's power to change them, they are not resting 
in God's power to save them...

If we could be saved by being good, then Christ would not have 
had to die. But the cross is the only way to salvation...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, Forgive me for the times I have attempted
to earn my salvation. Help me to grow in faith in Jesus Christ.
Help me to share my faith with those who do not know You as
they should...Amen.

Keep looking up, and He will answer your prayers...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

07/17/08~~~(food for thought)~~~Both salvation and sanctification are 
the work of the Holy Spirit...

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul says, "Let me ask you this one question: did you receive
the Holy Spirit by keeping the law? Of course not, for the Holy 
Spirit came upon you only after you believed the message you 
heard about Christ...

Have you lost your senses? After starting your Christian lives in
the Spirit, why are you now trying to become perfect by your own
human efforts? (Gal. 3:2, 3) NLT

Our Lesson for Today:

It seems as though some of the believers in Galatia may have 
been in Jerusalem at Pentecost and received the Holy Spirit there.

They knew that they hadn't received the Holy Spirit by obeying the
Jewish laws. Paul stressed that just as they began their Christian 
lives in the power of the Spirit, so they should grow by the Spirit's
power...

The Galatians had taken a step backward when they had decided
to insist on keeping the Jewish laws...

We must realize that we grow spiritually because of God's work in 
us by His Spirit, not by following special rules...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the work of Your Holy Spirit.
I pray that I would continue to grow more sensitive to Your Spirit's
leading and guiding...Amen.

Keep looking up, in an attitude of prayer...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

07/18/08~~~(food for thought)~~~Ignorance is always swift to speak...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Does God give His Spirit and work miracles among you
because you observe the law, or because you believe 
what you have heard? (Gal. 3:5) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

The Holy Spirit gives Christians great power to live for God.
BUT some Christians want more than this. They want to live
in a state of perpetual excitement...

The tediousness of their everyday lives leads them to conclude 
that something is wrong spiritually. Often the Holy Spirit's work 
is teaching us to persist, to keep on doing what is right even when
it no longer seems interesting or exciting...

If your Christian life seems ordinary, you may need the Holy Spirit 
to stir you up. Sometimes faith alone seems to easy, but if we allow 
the Holy Spirit to stir us up excitement will return to our lives...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that Your Spirit would
stir in me the excitement I found when I first invited
You into my heart...Amen.

Keep looking up, in an attitude of prayer...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

07/19/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ He gives power to the faint; and to them that have 
no might He increases strength. (Isa. 40:29)

Our Bible Verse for Today:

Consider Abraham: He believed God, and it was credited to him
as righteousness...

Understand, then, that those who believe are children of Abraham.

The Scripture foresaw that God would justify the Gentiles by faith,
and announced the gospel in advance to Abraham: "All nations
will be blessed through you."

So those who have faith are blessed along with Abraham, the man
of faith...(Gal 3:6-9)

Our Lesson for Today:

The main argument that Paul had to deal with from the Judaizers was 
that Gentiles had to become Jews in order to become Christians...

But Paul exposed the flaw in this argument by showing that real children
of Abraham are those who have faith, not those who keep the law.
Abraham himself was saved by faith (Gen. 15:6)...

The wonderful promise is that all believers in every age and from every
nation share Abraham's blessing. This is a comforting promise, a great
heritage for us, a solid foundation for living...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, we truly have much to rejoice about though our
personal relationship with Jesus Christ. We can truly sing, "What a fellowship, 
what a joy divine, leaning on the everlasting arms." I pray once again for a
great revival so that this song would be the anthem of our nation...Amen.

Keep looking up in an attitude of Prayer...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Our Bible Verses for Today:

All who rely on observing the law are under a curse, for it is
written: "Cursed is everyone who does not continue to do 
everything written in the book of the law."

Clearly no one is justified before God by the law, because,
"The righteous will live by faith." (Gal. 3:10, 11) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

Trying to be right with God by our own effort doesn't work.
Good intentions such as "I will do better next time" or "I'll
never do that again" usually end in failure...

trusting God ~ believing in His provision for our sins and
living each day in His power ~ we can break this cycle of 
failure...

Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to walk each day in faith 
in Christ's finished work on the cross. Help to pray without 
ceasing renewing my mind and spirit...Amen.

Keep looking up, in an attitude of prayer...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

07/22/08~~~(food for thought)~~~He who throws dirt loses ground. (Eph. 4:25)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Paul says: "Let me take an example from everyday life.
Just as no one can set aside or add to a human covenant 
that has been duly established, so it is in this case..."

The promises were spoken to Abraham and to his seed.
The Scripture does not say, 'and to his seeds,' meaning
many people, but "and to your seed," meaning one person,
who is Christ...

What I mean is this: The law, introduced 430 years later, does 
not set aside the covenant previously established by God and 
thus do away with the promise... (Gal. 3:15-17) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

God kept His promise to Abraham (Gen. 17:7, 8) ~ He has not revoked it, 
though thousands of years have passed. He saved Abraham through his 
faith, and He blessed the world through Abraham by sending the Messiah 
as one of Abraham's descendants...

Circumstances may change, but God remains constant and does not break 
His promises. He has promised to forgive our sins through Jesus Christ, 
and we can be sure He will do so. Praise the Lord, what a Savior...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your promise to forgive all
who confess their sins. I thank You for the promise of salvation
through Your Son of Lord Jesus Christ. I lay before you today again
my sins wash my heart white as snow...Amen.

Keep looking up, in an attitude of prayer...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

07/23/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ The first step to wisdom is silence;
the second is listening. (Pro. 1:5).

Our Bible Verses for Today:

For if the inheritance depends on the law, then it no longer
depends on the promise; but God in His grace gave it to
Abraham through a promise...

What, then, was the purpose of the law? It was added because 
of transgressions until the Seed to whom the promise referred
had come. The law was put into effect through angels by a mediator...
(Gal 3:18, 19) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

We need to remember the law has two functions. On the positive
side, it reveals the nature and will of God and shows people how
to live...

On the negative side, it points out people's sins and shows them 
it is impossible to please God by trying to obey all His laws completely.

God's promise to Abraham dealth with Abraham's faith; the law focuses 
on actions. The covenant with Abraham shows that faith is the only way 
to be saved; the law shows how to obey God in grateful response...

Faith does not annul the law, but the more we know God, the more we 
see how sinful we are, and so we are driven to depend on our faith in 
Christ alone for our salvation...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I bow humbly before You today
in recognition of my sinful being. I bring all my sins before 
you today, because I need Your power to over come the 
temptations of Satan. Increase my faith that I might realize 
that I need to turn to You each and every day for added strength...Amen.

Keep looking up in an attitude of prayer...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

07/28/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ A minute of thought is worth more than
an hour of talk...(Ps. 141:3).

Our Bible Verses for Today:

So the law was put in charge to lead us to Christ that we
might be justified by faith...

Now that faith has come, we are no longer under the
supervision of the law...(Gal. 3:24, 25) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

The picture of the law as being a guardian is similar to a
teacher giving a young child supervision. The law teaches 
us the need for salvation. God's grace gives us that salvation...

The Old Testament still applies today. In it, God reveals His nature, 
His will for humanity, His moral laws, and His guidelines for living.
But we cannot be saved by keeping the law, we must trust in Christ...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You that Your Word is the same
yesterday ~ today ~ and forever. I thank You that it shows me 
my need for a Savior. Help me to continue to be sensitive to Your
truth...Amen.

Keep looking up, in an attitude of prayer...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

07/29/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ You can win more friends with your ears
than with your mouth...

Our Bible Verse for Today:

There is neither Jew or Greek, slave nor free, male nor female, 
for you are all one in Christ Jesus...(Gal. 3:28) NIV 

Our Lesson for Today:

Some Jewish males greeted each new day by praying, "Lord I thank
You that I am not a Gentile, a slave, or a woman." The role of a woman
was enhanced by Christianity...

Faith in Christ transcends these differences and makes all believers one
in Christ. We need to make sure we do not impose distinctions that Christ
has removed.

Because all believers are His heirs, no one is more privileged or superior
to anyone else. We need to make a point to seek out and appreciate people
who are not just like us or our friends. We may find that we have a lot in 
common with them...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me for the times I may have
looked down my nose at someone who looked different than
me or my friends. Help me to love even the people who are 
different because You have created us all one in Christ...Amen.

Keep looking up, in an attitude of prayer...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: Blessed as Children of Abraham
verse_text: If you belong to Christ then you are Abraham's seed, and heirs according to the promise.

07/31/08~~~(food for thought)~~~Put others before yourself, and you can become
a leader among men...(Mt. 20:26, 27)

Our Bible Verse for Today:

When the time had fully come, God sent His Son,
born of a woman, born under the law,

to redeem those under the law, that we might receive
the full rights of sons...(Gal 4:4, 5) NIV

Our Lesson for Today:

"When the right time came." I love these words because it reminds
me that God's time is perfect. We need to remember this when we 
are dealing with the storms of this life...

Yes when the time was right God even sent His Son to earth to die 
for our sins. For centuries the Jews had been wondering when their
Messiah would come ~ but God's timing was perfect...

Oh yes we too may sometimes wonder if God will ever respond to
our prayers. BUT we must never doubt Him or give up hope. At the
right time He will respond...

Are you waiting for God's timing??? Trust His judgment and trust that
He has your best interests in mind...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me for becoming so focused on the 
storms of this life, that I loose sight of You. Help me to trust in Your
judgment with the assurance that you have my best interests in mind...Amen.

Keep looking up, keep your focus on Him...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

08/01/08 ~~~ (food for thought) ~~~ Feed your faith and your doubts will 
starve to death...(Heb.10:39)

Our Bible Verses for Today:

Because you are sons, God sent the spirit of His Son into
our hearts, the Spirit who calls out "Abba, Father"

So you are no longer a slave, but a son; and since you are a
son, God has made you also an heir...(Gal. 4:6, 7) NIV.

Our Lesson for Today:

Under Roman law, an adopted child was guaranteed all
legal rights to his father's property, even if he was formerly 
a slave. He was not a second-class son, He was equal to 
all other sons, biological or adopted, in his father's family.

As adopted children of God we share with Jesus all rights 
to God's resources. As God's heirs, we can claim what He
has provided for us ~ our full identity as His children...
(see Ro. 8:15-17)

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the provisions You
have made for me. I pray that as a son I would become 
more and more Christ-like...Amen.

Keep looking up, with this prayer in mind...
You are in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
